column5: I'm trying to find somewhere (preferably central ontario, between muskoka and algonquin) to camp for 4 days, I'd like it to have most of the classic elements of a bass lake (to gain experience) it would also have to be canoe-friendly. The things I'd really like are pencil reeds, lots of pads and cabbage. Thanks for any suggestions! (if possible it would also be nice to have a secluded camp ground, so no trailers and packed together sites.)
Why not go to Six Mile lake? Canoe friendly ..
I always avoided it because it seemed as though it was a loud and busy park...
Unfortunately I don't think you'll have many choices..  Early morning/late evenings are the best anyhow, not to much traffic out on the lake then.

You don't ask for much do you! LOL The specifics you ask for doesn't really fit that area from my experience. However, there are many lakes and campsites around the Dorset/Dwight area that have bass in the lakes. They aren't your classic bass lakes, but try tubes, drop shotting and wacky rigs.
Ya I know it was a long shot, just really want to get some bass practice, i would use a less pristine site but when the other campers don't fish you have to have something for them.

Once you launch yer canoe in the early morning,you will be on the lake all day.So whats the prob? You can take the whole day,(12 hours)to do the shore line. You would be surprised,how long you can spend on just one spot on that lake. First lake I was ever taken for a canoe fish when I was 12.Then again,the times have changed. To bad.
Check out Sec Lake in Algonquin Park.
I think I know where I'm going (got a tip) but if anyone has anymore suggestions feel free to post!
Algonquin would be a good choice!
Does anyone else see the irony in him keeping it a secret? LOL

I find Opeongo a little tougher to fish with all the big boats but I agree it's got some nice fish, and for grimsby I would tell you but it's a sensitive place that I got a strict don't tell anyone on, soooo ya...
....so take that suggestion and run with it

If you want to do some hiking and portaging with a canoe, I can give you some directions to a couple good Bass lakes near the Magnetewan River( Georgian Bay north of Point au Baril)  PM me if your interested...
